description.hltext_display: IBM、ネティーザ買収後もNECとDWHアプライアンスの共同開発を継続
description.content:
米IBMとNECは12月22日、11月のIBMによるNetezzaの買収完了後も、NECとNetezzaが合意したデータウェアハウス（DWH）アプライアンスの共同開発契約を継続すると発表した。
米IBMとNECは12月22日、11月のIBMによるNetezzaの買収完了後も、NECとNetezzaが合意したデータウェアハウス（DWH）アプライアンスの共同開発契約を継続すると発表した。同契約に基づき、今後もNECは共同開発したDWHアプライアンスを全世界に向けて販売していくとしている。
米IBMは9月にNetezzaを約17億ドルで買収すると発表。米国時間の11月11日に買収の完了を発表している。IBMは、同買収について、Business Analytics and Optimization（BAO）コンサルティング組織が提供するサービスを含む、情報およびアナリティクス事業を強化するものだとしている。
一方、NECとNetezzaは、2月にDWH製品の共同開発を発表。その第1弾として「InfoFrame DWH Appliance」の販売を4月に開始しており、四国コカ・コーラボトリングをはじめ6社への導入が決定しているという。
NECブランドで共同開発したアプライアンスは、Netezzaのストリーミングアーキテクチャおよび分析データベースソフトウェアと、NECのサーバおよびストレージプラットフォームとを組み合わせた製品。NECは、多くのユーザーへ多様なDWH製品を導入した実績があり、そのうち、NetezzaアーキテクチャのDWH製品については、日本だけでも25社を超えるトップ企業へ展開しているとする。NECでは今後、IBMと共同開発したアプライアンスによって、DWHビジネスのさらなる成長を目指すとしている。

description.hltext_display: Выставка икон Андрея Рублёва открылась в Третьяковке
description.content:
Выставка приурочена к 650-летию со дня рождения мастера
Иконы кисти Андрея Рублева, рукописные книги и фрагменты фресок - в Третьяковской галерее. Выставка приурочена к 650-летию со дня рождения Андрея Рублева, сообщает vesti.ru.
Сенсация выставки - фрагменты каменных блоков, найденных при археологических работах в Благовещенском соборе Кремля. Предполагают, что росписи на них сделаны после 1416 года при участии Андрея Рублева.
"Понятие духа Божия, двигающего кончиком кисти, оно и в звенигородских, и в других шедеврах - поразительно. Мы можем ощутить достоинство мастера не в огромной конструкции, а вот именно - игра кисти", - говорит директор Центрального музея древнерусской культуры и искусства им. Андрея Рублева Геннадий Попов.
Имя Андрея Рублева обросло легендами, а в ХХ веке - научными гипотезами после того, как в 1904 году реставраторы расчистили "Троицу", а в 1918 году были обнаружены иконы Звенигородского чина и фрески Успенского собора во Владимире. До сих пор эксперты считают, что эти три памятника принадлежат кисти Рублева. Только сохранились они не лучшим образом.
"Надо разделять те предметы, которые хранятся в музеях, и те, которые находятся в храмах, - считает куратор выставки Наталья Шередега. - Вся наша и научная общественность и люди, заинтересованные в сохранении отечественного наследия, обеспокоены будущим фресок Успенского собора во Владимире, равно как и тех фрагментов, которые связаны со Звенигородом".
Чтобы показать все девять частей Васильевского чина - обычно в экспозиции представлены лишь пять - в Третьяковке переоборудовали один из залов, где памятникам XV века создали особые климатические условия.
"Когда мы говорим об экспонировании древних памятников, таких, как древние иконы, здесь очень важно такое понятие, как движение воздуха. На иконы, которые экспонируются на стенах, минимальное осуществляется движение воздуха. А основной поток идет в центр зала: туда, где будет находиться публика", - поясняет Татьяна Городкова, главный хранитель Государственной Третьяковской галереи.
Иконы Васильевского чина во Владимире, Звенигородский чин и "Троица" - срез творчества Рублева в едином пространстве. Еще 50 лет назад, когда праздновали 600-летие художника, такое казалось невообразимым. Возможны ли сегодня новые находки?
"У нас есть один комплекс, который очень хочется чистить, но очень опасно: чистить-то что? А сохранить потом как? Это иконостас Троицкого собора Троице-Сергиевой Лавры около 1425 года - Даниил, Андрей Рублев и другие мастера. Очень хочется при жизни увидеть хоть одним глазком не только крошечные пробы, которые сделал институт реставраторов, но и что-то еще", - говорит Геннадий Попов.
"Евангелие" Хитрово и икона, хранящаяся в Париже, предположительно, могут иметь отношение к кисти великого Рублева. Но пока это только гипотезы, над которыми продолжают работать ученые.
Добавить: Класс! Facebook

description.hltext_display: USA belangen Deutsche Bank für Steuersparmodelle
description.content: New York (dpa) - Die USA haben die Deutsche Bank für ihre Beteiligung an illegalen Steuersparmodellen zur Rechenschaft gezogen. Das Frankfurter Geldhaus willigte ein, rund eine halbe Milliarde Dollar an den amerikanischen Fiskus zu zahlen. Im Gegenzug würde der Fall nicht weiter verfolgt, teilte die US- Bundesstaatsanwaltschaft mit. Die Fälle liegen nach Angaben der Deutschen Bank allerdings schon Jahre zurück - von 1996 bis 2002.

description.hltext_display: Januari 2011, Pembangunan Pasar Rejowinangun?
description.content:
Berita Aktual » Daerah
Januari 2011, Pembangunan Pasar Rejowinangun Dimulai
Magelang, CyberNews. Wali Kota Ir H Sigit Widyonindito MT menargetkan peletakan batu pertama pembangunan Pasar Rejowinangun dilaksanakan Januari 2011. "Kami terus bekerja keras melaksanakan percepatan agar target bisa dipenuhi," kata Kasubag Penyusunan Program DPU Kota Magelang, Agus Susatyo BE, Rabu (22/12).
Mengenai permintaan DPRD agar November 2011 pembangunannya selesai, dia menyatakan, dari perhitungan teknis bisa selesai. Namun, itu tergantung dari kesiapan investor PT Reka Konstruksi-PT Rizki Kembar Jaya-PT Bratautama Roda Mandiri. "Hari ini investor bertemu dengan Sekda dan SKPD membahas percepatan tersebut."
Seperti diberitakan sebelumnya, investor menunggu Pemkot Magelang mengirimkan detail engineering design (DED) yang baru. "Sambil menunggu DED baru, kami terus melakukan persiapan administrasi. Itu bentuk keseriusan dari kami," tutur Benny, salah seorang pimpinan perusahaan joint operation tersebut.
Jika nanti investor, pemkot maupun pedagang sudah sepakat tentang DED, maka langkah selanjutnya seperti penandatangan nota kesepahaman dan sebagainya bisa dilaksanakan. "Setelah pemkot menerbitkan surat perintah kerja (SPK) kami langsung bekerja," tegasnya.
Agus Susatyo menerangkan, yang belum selesai antara lain mengenai harga jual kios dan los per meter perseginya. Investor nanti akan bertemu dengan pedagang untuk melakukan musyawarah.
( Doddy Ardjono /CN14 )

description.hltext_display: Christina Olds: Answering Steamboat’s siren song
description.content:
/p> Copy and paste the link:
Blog about this Blog about this page on your steamboatpilot.com blog.
Upcoming Event
(One-off place), Chicago, IL
Not available
Steamboat Springs — Three days before Christmas 1968 my father loaded us into the family station wagon and headed to Steamboat Springs for a week of skiing. We left from our quarters at the U.S. Air Force Academy in Colorado Springs where he was commandant of cadets.
Normally, we drove to Vail to ski on weekends, and I remember being happy that this trip would not involve driving over Loveland Pass. The vacation would prove to be the best Christmas present of all for my father. He fell in love with Steamboat on a snowy Christmas Eve as we walked along Lincoln Avenue to the Old West Steak House. He told us that night, “We’re going to live here someday.”
Five years later, in June 1973, Brigadier Gen. Robin Olds retired from the Air Force and made good on his dream. We left Southern California in a convoy of three cars: the same Pontiac station wagon, an old green Jeep painted with the name of all of my father’s aircraft “SCAT,” and my little Ford Pinto. Behind us by a day was the moving van with all the family furniture and possessions. We arrived in Steamboat on a balmy and lovely spring evening. My sister and I saw our new house for the first time, a three-bedroom A-frame on Après Ski Way, and we were enchanted. There were very few houses on the mountain at that time. The pastoral views of the Yampa Valley seemed like paradise to me. That first evening, my father and I sat out on the front deck with beers. I remember the tears in his eyes as he whispered, “I am home.”
That statement proved true for his remaining 34 years. As he settled into home at the base of Mount Werner, I got on with my young adulthood by moving to San Francisco after college. There, for the next 22 years, I raised a family and worked hard in corporate management jobs, commuting daily across the Golden Gate Bridge. The majority of vacations, summer and winter, were spent in Steamboat. We skied, hiked, fished, golfed, camped, went to the rodeo, tubed the Yampa, hung out at Tugboat and Dos Amigos and bashed joyfully through secret stashes of powder. I envied my dad, but his words of wisdom to me during those years kept me grounded: “You have to earn your way to the mountains.”
For those of us not born and raised in Steam­boat, it makes sense. We are drawn here and united by a common love and appreciation for the lifestyle and the landscape. Once here after life in the “real world,” the magic can’t be taken for granted.
In 2003, I finally found my way out of the cities of the West Coast and back to Colorado. Lured by the reality of my father’s declining years, it was easy to give up traffic and all the cultural trappings of big-world civilization in exchange for the Rocky Mountains and living near my dad. Wanting to give him his space and explore a job with Vail Resorts, I moved to Keystone and then to Vail, traveling often to Steamboat for visits. In late 2006, he was diagnosed with congestive heart failure, and in February 2007, I moved into his house as caretaker. Sadly, he left us that June, and I was left with the heart-felt promise I’d made him to finish his memoirs. Three months later, I moved back to Vail to renew my life there, or so I thought.
The following two years proved to be the most challenging and demanding of my life as I worked to organize my dad’s loose notes, letters and bits of writing, all left in no chronological order. I contacted pilots who had flown with him, researched official military records, watched hours of taped interviews and locked myself away from the world to write and edit the book. “Fighter Pilot: The Memoirs of Legendary Ace Robin Olds” was published in April 2010, and the past seven months were spent promoting the book across the country at air shows, aviation museums and bookstores. When all was done, the Yampa Valley called to me. This tired girl has finally found her way back to Steamboat. It’s good to be home.

description.hltext_display: Online Payroll Software Now Available for Businesses in Ohio

Patriot PAY calculates all required federal, state and local taxes, and the user-friendly design of the software makes it easy to customize payroll deductions and contributions for each employee. description.hltext_display: Ramsauer räumt Defizite bei der Bahn ein
description.content: Berlin (dpa) - Bundesverkehrsminister Peter Ramsauer hat angesichts der aktuellen Verkehrsprobleme jahrelange Versäumnisse bei der Bahn eingeräumt. Man habe mit erheblichen technischen Problemen zu kämpfen, die aus der Vergangenheit herrührten, sagte der CSU- Politiker im ARD-Morgenmagazin. In den letzten zehn Jahren sei zudem an der sogenannten Bereithaltung gespart worden. Die Probleme ließen sich nicht von heute auf morgen beheben. Die Politik werde zusammen mit den einzelnen Verkehrsträgern alles daran setzt, dass die Dinge in Ordnung gebracht würden, so Ramsauer.

description.hltext_display: Vier Tote bei Erdbeben im Iran
description.content: TEHERAN (dpa). Bei einem Erdbeben der Stärke 6,5 sind am Montagabend im Südosten des Irans vier Menschen getötet worden. Das Büro des örtlichen Gouverneurs hatte zunächst von sieben Opfern gesprochen, diese Zahl dann aber reduziert. Nach Angaben des Gouverneurs der Provinz Kerman, Ismael Najar, stammten die Opfer aus mehreren Dörfern. Die Region sei eher dünn besiedelt. Das Zentrum des Bebens lag in einem Ort in der Nähe der Stadt Hossein Abad. Mehrere Dörfer wurden stark zerstört. Werbung

description.hltext_display: Victim clings to life; hit-and-run probe continues
description.author: Richard
description.content:
WHITE PLAINS ? As hit-and-run-victim Raul Rios continues to fight for his life at the Westchester Medical Center, police are methodically going through evidence and gathering more as they try to identify the driver of a black Mercedes-Benz sedan that hit him and drove away early Sunday. "This case is our priority," Public Safety Commissioner David Chong said Tuesday, noting that Monday's arrest of second-degree murder suspect Johnny Richberg in an unrelated case "gives us additional resources to focus on this incident."
Rios, 23, of White Plains was hit by a late-model black Mercedes about 4 a.m. as he was crossing East Post Road toward a Kennedy Fried Chicken restaurant.
Seconds later, a Yonkers woman and a Montgomery man who went into the street to help him were struck by a car that police said was driven by David Bautista, 22, of White Plains.
Bautista, who police said also continued driving, was stopped about a block away and later charged with misdemeanor counts of driving while intoxicated and leaving the scene of an accident. The two who went to Rios' aid, who police said did not know each other or Rios, were treated for minor injuries at White Plains Hospital Center.
Both have since given statements to police.
Chong said the first hit-and-run incident was captured on surveillance video which clearly shows the Mercedes hitting Rios, who remains in critical condition.
"We want this driver to turn himself in and tell us what happened," Chong said.
In the meantime, he said, police are working around the clock to identify the driver.
Detective Lt. Eric Fischer, commander of the Detective Division, said that in addition to interviewing witnesses, investigators are reviewing video "from every possible storefront" as well as footage taken by city surveillance cameras.
Fischer said cops are trying to determine the route the Mercedes took before and after the incident, adding that video is being enhanced in an effort to identify the license plate number.
Cops are also trying to determine the model and year of the Mercedes and are checking with dealers and repair shops to see if any that fit the description have been brought in for repairs since the incident.
Fischer said police are also checking state Department of Motor Vehicle records for all registered Mercedes-Benz owners in the area.
"The best thing would be for the driver to turn himself in," Fischer said.
In a statement released late Monday, Rios' family implored "the person or persons responsible for this horrific act to come forward."
Police asked anyone with information on the incident to call the Detective Division at 914-422-6217 or 914-422-6223. Calls will be kept confidential.

description.hltext_display: North Iraq Kurdistan's 'Change' Bloc withdraws from new cabinet
description.content:
BAGHDAD: North Iraq Kurdistan's "Change" Bloc has withdrawn from the new cabinet, proposed by Prime Minister Designate, Nouri al-Maliki, acccording to its spokesman, Sardar Abdullah on Tuesday in a news conference, attended by Aswat al-Iraq news agency.
"The Change Bloc has demanded two service cabinet posts, as well as a deputy prime-minister's post in the new government, but the constitutionally-authorized party to form the government, represented by the Prime Minister Designate, did not fulfil its obligations, as we were granted one ministerial post only; so we decided to withdraw from the government, though we shall continue our support for the political process through our presence in the parliamentarian opposition," Abdullah said.
"Prime Minister Designate, Nouri al-Maliki, has violated the principlel of national-partnership, through his non-filfilment of his commitments towards us, along with the margination efforts by the National and Kurdistan Alliances to force us return to the Kurdistan Alliance, being part of the sectarian marginalization attempts," he confirmed."
© Aswat Aliraq 2010

description.hltext_display: Ruling likely today in Emanuel residency case
description.content:
CHICAGO | Former White House Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel won't have to wait much longer to see if he'll be on the ballot for Chicago mayor.
The Chicago Board of Election Commissioners says the hearing officer handling residency challenges against Emanuel is likely to issue his recommendation today. The election board then meets Thursday and could decide the case that day. No matter what the board decides, the case is likely to end up in court.
More than two dozen people have challenged Emanuel's candidacy claiming he isn't a Chicago resident because he lived for nearly two years in Washington working for President Barack Obama.
Emanuel quit his job to come back to Chicago in October after Mayor Richard Daley announced he wouldn't seek a seventh term.

description.hltext_display: Junge baut Schneehöhle und wird verschüttet
description.content: SUHL (AFP). Ein 14-jähriger Junge aus Steinbach-Hallenberg in Thüringen ist beim Bau einer Schneehöhle unter einstürzenden Schneemassen begraben worden. Wie die Polizei in Suhl am Dienstag mitteilte, fand der Großvater den nicht mehr ansprechbaren Jungen erst einige Zeit später. Die sofort herbeigerufenen Rettungskräfte reanimierten den 14-Jährigen zwar noch, er starb aber später im Krankenhaus. Werbung

description.hltext_display: Defensores por los derechos gay ganan en la ONU
description.content:
Los defensores de los derechos de los homosexuales lograron el martes una victoria tras una larga batalla en la ONU cuando los estados integrantes restauraron una referencia a la orientación sexual, anulada hace un mes en una resolución contra el homicidio injustificado de minorías.
La remoción de la referencia el mes pasado, bajo solicitud de los países africanos y árabes, alarmó a los activistas por los derechos humanos que sostienen que los homosexuales están entre los grupos minoritarios que necesitan una protección especial contra los asesinatos extrajudiciales e injustificados. La embajadora estadounidense Susan Rice dijo en ese entonces que estaba ''encolerizada'' por el cambio y anunció que apoyaría la medida para restaurar la redacción del documento.
El incidente desató algo similar a una guerra cultural en el organismo internacional. La batalla subraya la división que hay entre los integrantes de la ONU por sus diversas preocupaciones religiosas y culturales sobre los asuntos de los derechos de los homosexuales.
Bélgica, Finlandia y otros países occidentales votaron a favor de incluir los detalles sobre la orientación sexual en la redacción. Mientras que una coalición de países africanos dijo estar ''gravemente alarmada'' por la referencia directa a la orientación sexual que fue incluida y calificó el hecho como un intento ''por crear nuevos derechos, nuevos estándares y nuevos grupos''.
Boris Dittrich, director del programa por los derechos de los homosexuales en la organización Human Rights Watch, dijo estar ''aliviado'' por la votación y reconoció a Rice por introducir la nueva enmienda.
''La resolución le hace justicia a los gays, lesbianas y transgéneros en países donde son objeto de ataques y asesinatos'', dijo Dittrich. ''Los crímenes por intolerancia ante la orientación sexual o la identidad de género de las víctimas deben ser combatidos igual que los crímenes de intolerancia cometidos por las diferencias de raza o religión''.
El presidente Barack Obama dijo que la votación para restaurar la redacción de la resolución ''marca un momento importante en la lucha por los derechos humanos y civiles''.
''Ha llegado el momento de que los países redoblen los esfuerzos para terminar con la discriminación y la violencia contra las personas lesbianas, homosexuales, bisexuales y transgénero'', dijo. ogsr

description.hltext_display: Gibt's an Weihnachten zu viel Weiß?
description.content:
Weiter Probleme an Flughäfen. BERLIN (dpa). Wenige Tage vor Heiligabend wächst in vielen Teilen Deutschlands die Sorge, dass das Winterwetter Tausenden das Weihnachtsfest verdirbt. Reisende saßen am Dienstag weiter auf Flughäfen oder an überfüllten Bahnsteigen fest. Vor allem auf den europäischen Luftfahrtdrehkreuzen blieb die Lage so angespannt, dass die EU-Kommission die Flughafenchefs zum Rapport einbestellte. Bei Arbeiten an verschneiten Gleisen kamen in Köln vier Arbeiter beim Schneeräumen ums Leben. Gute Nachrichten gibt es hingegen für alle, die das Wetter positiv sehen wollen: Die Chancen für weiße Weihnachten stehen gut. Vor allem der Flugverkehr in Europa wurde am Dienstag weiter massiv behindert. Der Rhein-Main-Flughafen Frankfurt musste am frühen Morgen wegen neuer Schneefälle gesperrt werden. Am Vormittag konnte der Betrieb zwar wieder aufgenommen werden, 300 Flüge wurden aber gestrichen. Über Stunden war nur eine der drei Start- und Landebahnen freigegeben. Inzwischen entbrannte ein Streit zwischen dem Betreiber Fraport und dem Deutschen Wetterdienst, ob die Niederschläge für Frankfurt überhaupt vorhergesagt worden sind. Werbung
Der Flughafen London-Heathrow war am Dienstag am vierten Tag in Folge weitgehend lahmgelegt. Nur 30 Prozent der Flüge konnten abgewickelt werden, teilte der Flughafenbetreiber mit. Auf dem Flughafen Paris-Charles de Gaulle kam es ebenfalls zu Verspätungen. Auch auf dem Flughafen Brüssel-Zaventem in Belgien wurden zahlreiche Flüge gestrichen. Angesichts der Situation hat die EU-Kommission die Flughafenchefs einbestellt. "Diese Situation ist inakzeptabel und darf nicht wieder vorkommen", sagte EU-Verkehrskommissar Siim Kallas. Er kritisierte die schlechte Organisation der Flughäfen. In den kommenden Tagen erwarte er Erklärungen und Pläne, um Abhilfe zu schaffen. Schneefälle werden in vielen Regionen weiterhin erwartet. Ob die weiße Pracht allerdings bis Weihnachten hält, ist nach Angaben von Meteorologen noch nicht ganz gewiss. Von Donnerstag an komme es zum Gerangel zwischen milder Luft aus Südwest und Kaltluft aus Nordwest. "Für weiße Weihnachten sieht es gar nicht so schlecht aus", sagt der Meteorologe Lars Dahlstrom in Bochum. Die Chancen auf flächendeckendes Weiß in Deutschland schätzt er auf 80 Prozent.

description.hltext_display: Off the Beaten Path II hosts 9 local authors at event today
description.content:
Blog about this Blog about this page on your steamboatpilot.com blog.
Upcoming Event
(One-off place), Chicago, IL
Not available
Steamboat Springs — Local author Dagny Mc­­Kinley knows the connection among local authors and the Steamboat Springs community runs deep.
Today at Off the Beaten Path II, McKinley will have the chance to meet and sign books with eight other authors, including Christina Olds, whose father, Robin Olds, once inhabited the house McKinley now lives in. He’s also the subject of Christina’s historical memoir, “Fighter Pilot.”
“I think when you’re around other writers, it pushes writing to another level,” McKinley said. “It’s important to be challenged and inspired by others. Like Rod Hanna’s ‘Seasons of Gold,’ it’s a beautiful book, and it always stimulates my photography.”
Hanna, Olds and McKinley, who authored the dog sledding book “Wild Hearts,” are three of the nine authors scheduled to attend a book-signing event called Reveal the Local Connection from 4 to 8 p.m. today.
Off the Beaten Path II, a new ski area location for the bookstore based on Ninth Street in downtown Steamboat, opened its doors almost three weeks ago in the lobby of the Sheraton Steamboat Resort. Events and marketing coordinator Kim Keith said today’s event is intended to highlight local talents for residents and visitors.
“I think people don’t realize how many amazing people we have in this town,” Keith said. “I wanted to kind of bring them all together. It should be a lot of fun. I wanted to bring attention to our new location in the Sheraton and highlight these artists.”
Olds, Hanna and McKinley will be joined by cello player John Sant’Ambrogio, who wrote “The Day I Almost Destroyed the Boston Symphony Orch­estra.”
Local high school graduate Tori Christensen will be on hand with samples from her recently released gluten-free cookbook “A Bite of Heaven.”
Bonnie McGee, whose book is based on her circumnavigation of the globe on a sailboat, will give a slideshow presentation.
Historical, self-inspiring and regional geography books by local authors also will be highlighted.
“I think they’ll be amazed at the variety of authors we have,” Keith said about visitors who might stop by the bookstore today. “Just being able to meet one on one with people that created these pieces of work, whether it be a photograph or the writing … I think people will be amazed.”
McKinley, who will bring her Alaskan husky Alma Rose, said guests are likely to see another side of Steamboat at the book signing.
“I think hopefully they’ll get a little bit of the flavor of Steamboat and that different mix,” McKinley said. “Not only do they get to see the Steamboat landscape, they get to meet the people that make up that landscape.”

description.hltext_display: Saltkrise i København: Tunesisk julesalt forsinket
description.author: Kasper Brøndgaard Andersen
description.content:
150 ton salt fra Tunesien er forsinket, så tilstanden på de pletvis isglatte veje i København forværres over julen. I øjeblikket skrider en del bilister af vejen og ud i snedriverne - kommunen er løbet tør for salt.
Multimedia
Læs også
Læs mere om
Af Kasper Brøndgaard Andersen, onsdag 22. dec 2010 kl. 09:34
Københavnere, der vil have salt til julemaden, må hellere skynde sig ned i supermarkedet, inden kommunen hamstrer, hvad der står på hylderne.
Bystyret har manglet salt de seneste dage, så vejene ikke kan saltes, og nu lyder det så fra leverandøren, at en tunesisk saltsending, der skulle være leveret juleaften, er forsinket.
Det betyder, at kommunen først får fyldt på sine saltlagre efter jul.
»Vi har ikke fået nogen forklaring af leverandøren, men vi har fået at vide, at det først kommer 28. december. Vi ved simpelthen ikke, hvad begrundelsen er,« siger vinteransvarlig Kim N. Sørensen.
»Det betyder, at vi har 150 ton salt mindre at gøre godt med. Så det bliver endnu værre. Jeg vil tro, der ca. er 50 ton tilbage. Det er ingenting.«
Cykelstierne får stadig salt
Manglen på salt betyder, at kommunen kun rydder sine veje mekanisk. Cykelstierne får fortsat lidt salt og ser generelt bedre ud end vejbanen, men det er langtfra optimalt, lyder det fra den vinteransvarlige.
»Vi har pletvis isglatte veje overalt. Og det samme gælder byens cykelstier, som dog generelt har det bedre end kørebanerne,« siger Kim N. Sørensen.
Han har ikke et overblik over, hvor mange uheld det har medført, men der er angiveligt en del bilister der skrider af vejen og ud i snedriverne.
»Jeg har snakket med nogle taxichauffører, og de siger samstemmende, at de ikke oplever mange, der kører ind i hinanden. Men de oplever folk, der skrider ud og kører ind i snedriver.«
Ifølge Kim N. Sørensen kører folk forsigtigt, holder afstand og kører langsomt, og derfor går trafikken fuldstændig i stå i myldreperioderne om morgenen og eftermiddagen.

description.hltext_display: HUD rejects Westchester again on housing
description.author: Gerald
description.content:
|A federal agency has again told Westchester County its work on the housing settlement is "incomplete and unacceptable ." The Department of Housing and Urban Development said Tuesday that though County Executive Rob Astorino's administration has identified obstacles to building affordable housing in mostly white communities, it has failed to come up with solutions to accomplish those goals.
In not accepting the so-called analysis of impediments ? a key report that is at the core of a lawsuit and subsequent settlement ? HUD gave the county until April 1 to revise its analysis.
It's the latest in a series of back-and-forth between the county and federal government after they reached an agreement last year to spend roughly $52 million to help build 750 affordable homes over seven years in mostly white communities. The units are to be sold to nonwhites.
In a six-page letter, HUD wrote that though Westchester identifies challenges and the analysis shows clear evidence of racial segregation, it fails to address "actions the county will take to overcome them."
"This is a critical part of a landmark legal settlement the county agreed to nearly a year and a half ago," HUD said in a statement.
"While the county's Analysis of Impediments provides a large volume of data and information, it fails to make any material link between the barriers to fair housing choice that are evident in that data and the specific actions the County will take to overcome them," the statement said.
HUD identified two areas ? combating exclusionary local zoning laws as well as promoting housing for "low-income families of color" ? as examples of issues the county has not addressed.
In the original case, a federal judge ruled in 2009 that Westchester had "utterly failed to comply" with requirements that mandate such an analysis.
HUD and the court-appointed monitor, James E. Johnson, already granted the county two extensions for this analysis, but denied the third.
They also twice called on Westchester to redo its implementation plan while the monitor challenged the "tone at the top" after Astorino vetoed an anti-income-discrimination bill that would have made it illegal for landlords to deny tenants based on how they derive their income.(2 of 2)The settlement was brokered in 2009 under former County Executive Andrew Spano and the federal government and later ratified by the Board of Legislators. This latest letter, dated Dec. 21, is part of a broader process, said Ned McCormack, Astorino's senior adviser and communications director.
The county is balancing these planning tools (an implementation plan and analysis of impediments) with actual progress on buildings, McCormack said.
With 104 units already in the works in Rye and Cortlandt, the county is ahead of its 2011 benchmarks, he said.
"We're talking about the tools, but in terms of goals we're ahead of schedule," he said.
"You can't let the perfect drive out the good. We're showing terrific progress. They've asked for revisions, and we're going to make them," he said.
The leader of the group that filed the lawsuit, the Anti-Discrimination Center, called this latest development a "wholesale rejection."
"They have not showed any progress," said Craig Gurian, ADC's executive director. "And with the exception of some modest window dressing, Westchester has not made any progress."
Board of Legislators Chairman Ken Jenkins, D-Yonkers, who has been at odds with Astorino over many matters, including the housing order, shared a similar view.
He said HUD's message shows that the county executive is "not fulfilling our obligation."
Jenkins cited Astorino's cancellation of the contract for the Section 8 Housing Choice Program with the state as an area of concern.
"It's a repudiation of the direction and approach of this administration," Jenkins said. "We did not enter into an agreement to put us in jeopardy. We're going to look for specific action the admini

description.hltext_display: Bulldogs shoot down Aeros 5-0. Sanford picks up 2nd shutout of road trip
description.content:
Loading...
It will be a very satisfying Christmas break for the Hamilton Bulldogs.
The Dogs finished their four-game road trip through the southwestern U.S. Tuesday night with a 5-0 win over the Aeros in Houston.
The result meant the Dogs finished the trip with a 3-1 record and they padded their own lead atop the AHL’s North Division standings to six points over Abbotsford, B.C.
The Dogs now get four days off to enjoy the holidays before returning to action Sunday in Toronto.
The Bulldogs scored for the cycle in the first period scoring once at even strength, once on the power play and once while they were short-handed for a 3-0 lead.
Dustin Boyd scored his fifth goal in four games since being sent down from Montreal, even strength, at 9:12 to get them started.
Olivier Fortier made it 2-0 at 11:26 on a power play and David Desharnais got the first of his two short-handed goals 33 seconds later.
Ryan Russell, who had snapped a 20-game pointless streak with an assist on Desharnais’ goal, then snapped a 20-game goal-less drought at 2:51 of the second to make it 4-0.
Desharnais piled it on with his second goal while they were a man short at 6:58.
The third period was scoreless.
Curtis Sanford had a strong game in goal for the Dogs in picking up the win. The Aeros outshot Hamilton 38-28 including 23-6 in the second period.
It was Sanford’s second shutout of the season both coming in this road trip. He blanked Oklahoma City 3-0 on Friday night.
Anton Khudobin, who gave up all five goals, before being yanked in favour of Matt Hackett, took the loss.
The Bulldogs are back on the ice Boxing Day when they take on the Toronto Marlies at the Ricoh Coliseum in Hogtown.
That will be the Dogs’ fifth straight road game. They play at home twice next week. They host the Chicago Wolves on Tuesday, Dec. 28, and then entertain the Lake Erie Monsters of Clevland, Ohio on Thursday, Dec. 30.

description.hltext_display: Margaret Louise Paris Wright, 86
description.content:
LEBANON -- Funeral services were held Tuesday morning, Dec. 21 at the Partlow Funeral Chapel for Mrs. Wright, 86, of Lebanon.
Mrs. Wright died Friday, Dec. 17, 2010 at her residence.
Services were conducted by Brother G.W. Knight. Interment followed at Wilson County Memorial Gardens.
Survivors include: son Don (Marianne) Wright of Lascassas; sisters Ruby Davis of Murfreesboro and Emma Jean Adams Lester of Lebanon; grandchildren Christopher Brian Wright and Kristen Leigh Wright (Tommy) Scott -- both of Lascassas; great grandchildren Jason and Emma Scott; along with numerous nieces and nephews.
She is preceded in death by her husband, Rufus Clyde Wright and infant daughter Gwendolyn Faye Wright.
Family and friends served as pallbearers.
The family request that you help anyone in need and do so with her blessings.
Arrangements by Partlow Funeral Chapel, Lebanon.

description.hltext_display: World Bank allocates $90 millions for Iraq's Housing Projects
description.content:
BAGHDAD: The World Bank has granted Iraq a US$90 million credit to carry out projects, carried out by the Ministry of Housing & Reconstruction in different parts of the country, according to a Ministry statement on Tuesday.
"The Ministry has implemented a number of projects, financed by a US$90 million credit by the World Bank, covering the construction of several roads in southern Iraq's Wassit and Najaf Provinces, construction and rehabilitation of 10 main roads and 4 bridges in west Iraq's Babel and southern Iraq's Muthanna Provinces," the Ministry's Media Director told Aswat al-Iraq news agency.
He said among other projects, to be implemented by the Ministry using the credit would be rehabilitation of several roads, connecting towns and villages in Diwaniya, Kut, Nassiriya, Amara cities, along with a main highway connecting Baghdad with Kut.
© Aswat Aliraq 2010

description.hltext_display: Wenn Kinder über Hummeln forschen
description.content:
Eine Schulklasse in England hat nachgewiesen, dass die Insekten Farben wahrnehmen. LONDON (dpa). Britische Schulkinder haben eine wegweisende Entdeckung zum Gedächtnis von Hummeln gemacht und wurden damit ? als erste Schulklasse überhaupt ? mit einer Veröffentlichung in einem hoch angesehen Fachjournal belohnt. Die acht bis zehn Jahre alten Kinder der Blackawton School in Devonshire hatten sich damit auseinandergesetzt, ob Hummeln Farben wahrnehmen und sich merken können. Ihre Erkenntnisse sind in einer Fachzeitschrift, den biologischen Briefen der britischen Akademie Royal Society, veröffentlicht. Die jungen Forscher konnten mit ihren Experimenten nachweisen, dass Hummeln Farben und Muster im Gehirn aufnehmen können und in der Lage sind, sich diese danach zu merken. Die Farberkennung bei Insekten ist nach wie vor generell nur wenig erforscht. Die Arbeit der Kinder bedeute einen Fortschritt für die Forschung, heißt es in dem Magazin. Die Kinder hatten einen Plexiglaskubus gebaut. In diesem stand für die Hummeln Zuckerwasser hinter verschiedenen farblich gekennzeichneten Flächen. Nach einer Trainingsphase merkten sich die Tiere die Farbe der Zuckerwassertröge und verschmähten die Farben, hinter denen Salzwasser stand ? auch nach einem Positionswechsel. Die Forschungsarbeit der Kinder wurde von anderen Wissenschaftlern geprüft. "Die Forscher haben sich eine wissenschaftliche Frage gestellt und sie richtig beantwortet", heißt es im Kommentar der Royal Society. Lediglich Verweise auf frühere Forschungsarbeiten fehlten. Dies sei aber damit zu erklären, dass Grundschüler nicht unbedingt Zugang zu wissenschaftlichen Bibliotheken hätten. Werbung
"Ich bin hocherfreut, dass diese Arbeit veröffentlicht wird", sagte der Rektor der Blackawton School, Dave Strudwick. "Das Projekt bedeutet eine völlig neue Art des Arbeitens und des Lernens und ich hoffe, dass andere Schulen diesem Beispiel folgen", sagte er. Der Herausgeber der Zeitschrift, Brian Charlesworth, sagte: "Ich hoffe, das wird andere Gruppen dazu bringen zu realisieren, dass Wissenschaft kein exklusiver Club ist, sondern für jeden erreichbar."

description.hltext_display: Šibenčanin u suludoj jurnjavi skrivio nesreću s četvero ozlijeđenih, pa pobjegao iz bolnice
description.author: eljko Huljev
description.content:
ŠIBENIK - Četiri su osobe ozlijeđene od kojih jedna teško u prometnoj nesreći koja se u utorak nešto prije pola noći dogodila na dijelu Jadranske ceste između Šibenika i Vodica.
Do nesreće s nesvakidašnjim posljedicama došlo je u trenutku kada se Mario Perak, 39-godišnji Šibenčanin, vozač automobila Mercedes Vario Furgon, nailaskom na dugi i nepregledni zavoj dao u suludo i ubilačko pretjecanje kolone vozila, dok je iz suprotnog pravca na svojoj strani kolnika nailazio Ford Focus u kojem su bila dvojica pripadnika interventne postrojbe MUP-a.
Srećom, izbjegnut je izravni sudar, ali oba vozila udarila su u zaštitnu ogradu.
Nakon što je na svojoj strani kolnika iznenada uočio jureći Mercedes, vozač Focusa instinktivno je reagirao od prijetećeg direktnog sudara. Skrenuo je vozilo u desno češući se od metalni branik iz kojega su prema izjavama očevidaca sijevale iskre, dok se Mercedes nakon mimoilaženja u doslovno nekoliko centimetara, potom u punoj brzini nasadio na metalni branik po kojemu je nastavio vožnju u dužini od preko 20 metara.
Mahniti vozač Mercedesa zadobio je lakše tjelesne ozljede, kao i dvojica policajaca, dok je Andrej Bulat 40-godišnjak, također iz Šibenika i suvozač u furgonu, ostao zarobljen u hrpi lima, dijelova motora i metalnog branika koji je prošišao kroz vozilo.
Svi ozlijeđeni prevezeni su u Opću bolnicu Šibenik gdje je nakon dolaska vozila Hitne pomoći, vozač Mercedesa, odbio hospitalizaciju, iako je šepao, i iznenada pobjegao.
Pokrenuta je intenzivna potraga za njim. Zdravstveno stanje njegovog suvozača liječnici su ocijenili jako ozbiljnim s teškim fakturama donjih ekstremiteta. Pritom jednoj nozi prijeti amputacija.

description.hltext_display: Europe travel chaos eases but pain remains
description.author: Michael Roddy
description.content:
LONDON -- Airline and international train services were limping back toward normal in parts of Europe on Wednesday, but the lingering effects of ice and snow that caused widespread chaos still weighed on schedules. The disruptions to airlines and high-speed trains in continental Europe, and linking Britain to the continent, created a nightmare before Christmas scenario for tens of thousands of travelers since the weekend, when heavy snow fell.
They also brought calls for legislation to force airports to deal more effectively with snow and other bad weather.
European Union transport chief Siim Kallas said he was considering forcing airports to provide a minimum level of infrastructure support during severe weather.
London's Heathrow, the world's busiest international airport, and Frankfurt Airport, the biggest on the continent, which both had severe disruptions earlier in the week, said on their websites that operations were returning to normal.
Heathrow said it had reopened its second runway on Tuesday, offering a ray of hope for thousands of passengers stranded in departure halls, some for days in scenes that British newspapers said resembled refugee camps.
"The southern runway at Heathrow is now open. Airlines are currently operating a significantly reduced schedule while they move diverted aircraft and crew back into position," airport operator BAA, owned by Spain's Ferrovial, said on its website.
British Airways said that in line with a directive from BAA, it would operate only a third of its normal flight schedule at Heathrow until 6 a.m. on Thursday.
"It will take some time to rebuild an operation of our size and complexity at our hub airport, Heathrow," the airline said on its website.
"We ask you not to travel to the airport unless you have a confirmed booking on one of the flights that is operating."
Flights to and from Frankfurt Airport resumed on Tuesday morning after the airport was shut for several hours overnight.
German airline Lufthansa said the situation at Frankfurt "is gradually returning to normal" and that it "sees good prospects for a return to normal flight operations."
Eurostar, operator of the high-speed train between London and Brussels and Paris, said it would resume normal check-in service, but asked passengers not to show up until an hour before departure "to avoid congestion and an unnecessary wait."
On Tuesday, thousands of people were forced to queue in frigid temperatures for hours around St. Pancras station in north London as every available Eurostar seat was snapped up by travelers bounced from airlines.
Eurostar said nine of its 52 trains would be canceled on Wednesday but that passengers for those services would be "reallocated onto one of the next available trains."
Although the logjam of travelers was starting to ease, many passengers were irate.
"This was our holiday of a lifetime," a man at Heathrow who'd been planning to travel with his wife told Sky News. "And it's a nightmare."

event_or_fact.property: he was considering forcing airports to provide a minimum level of infrastructure support during severe weather

description.hltext_display: TV-Werbung, die Inhalte an Haushalte anpasst, in Vorbereitung
description.content: In Amerika plant der TV-Anbieter DirecTV Group eine neue Art der TV-Werbung. Bei dieser neuen Werbung werden die Inhalte an die Bedürfnisse der Bewohner angepasst. So sollen in Haushalten in denen Kinder leben, Werbungen angezeigt werden, die Produkte für Kinder bewerben. Haushalte in denen Hunde gehalten werden, bekommen dann die Werbungen angezeigt, in denen Produkte für Hunde vermarktet werden sollen. Für Werbetreibende wäre diese Form der Werbung sehr vielversprechend. Sie würden mit ihrer Werbung überwiegend die Kunden erreichen, für die die beworbenen Produkte auch gedacht sind. So könnten bessere Ergebnisse erreicht werden. Der Start für diese Art der Werbung soll im kommenden Jahr erfolgen.

description.hltext_display: Cinque per mille, i soldi ci sono Benzinai in rivolta: feste a rischio
description.author: online@quotidiano.net (Redazione
description.content:
Cinque per mille, i soldi ci sono Benzinai in rivolta: feste a rischio
Il decreto 'Milleproroghe' oggi in consiglio dei ministri: più tempo per smaltire i sacchetti di plastica, tre anni in più per la sicurezza nelle scuole
Giulio Tremonti, 63 anni (Ap / lapresse)
Contenuti correlati
Roma, 22 dicembre 2010 - Le risorse per il 5 per mille, il divieto di incroci editoria-Tv fino al dicembre 2012, più tempo per smaltire i sacchetti di plastica. Sono solo alcune delle misure che dovrebbero essere contenute nel ‘Milleproroghe’ che sarà approvato oggi dal Consiglio dei ministri.
Mentre sul piede di guerra sono scesi i benzinai che minacciano lo sciopero tra Natale a Capodanno se nel testo non entrerà il bonus fiscale per loro.
Ad annunciare che nel provvedimento ci saranno più risorse per il 5 per mille è stato il ministro dell’Economia, Giulio Tremonti. Si tratta di 300 milioni di euro che sommati ai 100 milioni di euro già stanziati nella legge di stabilità raggiungeranno complessivamente la somma di 400 milioni di euro per il 2011.
Tra gli altri interventi, la bozza del provvedimento dà un anno in più ai commercianti per smaltire i sacchetti di plastica; tre anni in più per la messa in sicurezza delle scuole; c’è poi l’ulteriore proroga, al 31 dicembre 2014, dell’obbligo di alienazione per gli azionisti delle banche popolari che al dicembre 2009 detenevano una partecipazione al capitale sociale superiore al tetto dello 0,5%. Quanto al termine per la validità delle graduatorie dei concorsi pubblici “è ulteriormente prorogato al 31 dicembre del 2011”. Slitta poi di un anno, dal primo gennaio 2010 al primo gennaio 2011 la soppressione degli Ato, gli ambiti territoriali ottimali.
Novità anche per i motorini e le nuove norme del codice della strada: slitta al primo ottobre l’introduzione della prova pratica di guida per i ciclomotori. Prorogata fino al 2012 anche la convenzione del ministero dello Sviluppo economico con Radio radicale per un costo di 10,2 milioni di euro per il 2012.
Tra le ipotesi anche novità per il sito archeologico di Pompei e la proroga sugli studi di settore. Mentre non è escluso che nel testo definitivo possano entrare anche misure sul bingo e le scommesse.

description.hltext_display: WikiLeaks: Bangladeshi security force accused of rights abuse
description.content:
London - A leaked US diplomatic cable has mentioned "alleged human rights violations" by a Bangladeshi paramilitary force, the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), that Britain has trained.
The Guardian, citing US diplomatic cables put out by WikiLeaks, reported that the British government has been training RAB which has been termed by human rights organisations as a "government death squad".
RAB personnel have received British training in "investigative interviewing techniques" and "rules of engagement", the media report said.
A cable said that the US would not offer any assistance other than human rights training to the RAB.
The US ambassador said in the cables that the US government is "constrained by RAB's alleged human rights violations, which have rendered the organisation ineligible to receive training or assistance" under laws which prohibit American funding or training for overseas military units which abuse human rights with impunity.
Some human rights activists have alleged that since the RAB was established six years ago it has been responsible for more than 1,000 extra-judicial killings. In September last year, the RAB director general said his men had killed 577 people in "cross-fire". In March this year he updated the figure, saying they had killed 622 people.
However, the cables also state that both the British and the Americans were in favour of bolstering the force and argued that the "RAB enjoys a great deal of respect and admiration from a population scarred by decreasing law and order over the last decade".
The US ambassador to Dhaka, James Moriarty, in a cable said that the RAB is the "enforcement organisation best positioned to one day become a Bangladeshi version of the US Federal Bureau of Investigation".
In another cable, Moriarty quotes British officials as saying they have been "training RAB for 18 months in areas such as investigative interviewing techniques and rules of engagement".

event_or_fact.property: British officials as saying they have been "training RAB for 18 months in areas such as investigative interviewing techniques and rules of engagement"
the RAB is the "enforcement organisation best positioned to one day become a Bangladeshi version of the US Federal Bureau of Investigation".

description.hltext_display: Johanna Hall: Give a new experience for the holidays
description.content:
Blog about this Blog about this page on your steamboatpilot.com blog.
Steamboat Springs — I try to be original with my gift giving. Lately, I’ve started to give the gift of fun and memorable experiences to those special people in my life.
Last year, I gave my boyfriend — who is a total bike geek with two of everything he could ever need for cycling — an experience with a snowbike. I learned to ride a snowbike when I worked for a ski area in the Northwest before moving to Steamboat. They are really fun, easy to learn and something everyone should try.
Steamboat Ski Area requires that all snowbike users take a lesson. Reservations are required. They offer half-day and full-day programs. I bought us the half-day rental just in case the experience wasn’t as fun for my boyfriend as I thought it might be.
We started the lesson at 8:30 a.m. at the ski school. They fitted us with our snowbikes and the tiny skis that attach to your boots. These are so you can unload a chairlift and glide down the ramp. They also help to balance and steer the snowbike. Within a very short time, we were out on snow with our instructor and getting a feel for the bikes.
The concept is simple: You steer the handle bars of the snowbike like you would a bike with wheels. As you sit on the snowbike, your feet and your knees help to balance and steer the bike. The biggest difference is that snowbikes don’t have brakes. You stop like you would in skiing or snowboarding — by simply making a turn.
Snowbikes have comfortable seats and rear shock absorbers. The handlebars control a front fork that has a ski independent from the rear ski, which supports most of your weight as you sit on the elongated seat. The front ski pivots for the turn and the rear ski simply follows.
Did I say it is easy? Everyone in our lesson group had it nailed in the first several tries. Within 15 minutes, we all loaded the lift and headed up the mountain.
Our enthusiastic instructor gave us pointers, and once he felt we were proficient on the snowbikes, he signed us off as independent riders. We are now able to rent snowbikes without a lesson, and we received a laminated ID card that allows us to rent snowbikes and any Colorado ski resort that offers them.
After saying our goodbyes to our lesson comrades, we headed for the top of the mountain. The snowbikes go everywhere! We biked on the groomers, in the powder, did the bumps on Three O’Clock, the trees on Twilight and just about all of our favorite ski runs. The ski area stresses, however, that the bikes are not to be used in the terrain park.
It was a great experience and a successful gift and one that will be remembered. It is reasonably priced — $45 for a one-hour lesson and half-day rental. For my money, the snowbike experience tops any ill-fitting sweater or useless trinket you might otherwise buy a friend or family member. All cyclists will have fun on a snowbike — I guarantee it.
Johanna Hall is an administrative assistant for the Northwest Colorado Visiting Nurse Association in Steamboat Springs and a grant writer for Routt County Riders bicycle club. For more information about Routt County Riders, visit www.routtcountyriders.org.

description.hltext_display: In neuem Glanz
description.content:
Die Hagia Sophia in Istanbul ist restauriert ? pünktlich zum Ende des Kulturhauptstadt-Jahres. ISTANBUL. Nach fast 18 jähriger Arbeit ist das berühmteste Baudenkmal Istanbuls, die gut 1500 Jahre alte Hagia Sophia, nun wieder ohne Abdeckplanen und Gerüste zu besichtigen. Eigentlich hatte die restaurierte "Kirche der Weisheit" einer der Glanzpunkte der Kulturhauptstadt 2010 sein sollen, doch wie viele andere Projekte waren auch die Arbeiten an dem heutigen Museum stark in Verzug geraten.
Kurz vor dem Ende des Kulturhauptstadt-Jahres präsentierte nun Haluk Dursun, Direktor der Hagia Sophia, noch stolz sein Werk. Tatsächlich ist der Anblick überwältigend, den der berühmte Bau nun nach seiner Wiederherstellung im Innern bietet. Der gigantische Raum mit seiner berühmten Kuppel wird erhellt durch Dutzende wiederhergestellter Kronleuchter aus osmanischer Zeit. Sie erinnern daran, dass die einstige Hauptkirche des byzantinischen Reiches nach der Eroberung Konstantinopels 1453 knapp 500 Jahre auch als Moschee genutzt worden war, bevor sie 1935 zum Museum erklärt wurde. Andererseits heben die in den vergangenen Jahren in mühsamer Kleinarbeit wieder freigelegten Engel in der Rotunde der Kuppel auch den christlichen Charakter des Baues wieder hervor. Besonders stolz ist Haluk Dursun, dass es gelungen ist, ein Engelgesicht zu rekonstruieren. Von den vier Engelmosaiken waren zwei schon immer gesichtslos, während das dritte so zerstört ist, dass man es nicht wieder herstellen konnte. Werbung
Insgesamt besticht der gesamte Innenraum nun durch seine weltweit wohl einmalige Synthese christlicher und islamischer Kunst. Dort wo früher einmal der Altar hinter einer Ikonenwand stand, ist nun die nach Mekka weisende Gebetsnische. Aber in der Apsis darüber strahlt immer noch das Mosaik der Gottesmutter mit ihrem Kind auf dem Schoß. Auch eine kleine Sensation hat Haluk Dursun zu bieten. Erstmals seit der Eroberung ist das gigantische marmorne Taufbecken, welches die Osmanen ins Depot verbannt hatten, wieder zu sehen. An einem geschützten Platz im Lichthof kann sich vom Frühjahr an jeder Besucher ein Bild davon machen, wie die byzantinischen Kaiser in einem marmornen Pool eingetaucht wurden. Mit der Hagia Sophia erstrahlt nicht nur das meistbesuchte Denkmal Istanbuls wieder in neuem Glanz, auch die berühmteste Moschee, die Süleymanie Cami, wurde nach langer Bauzeit im Oktober wieder dem Publikum übergeben. Während so einige der wichtigsten historischen Bauten der Stadt mit dem Geld, das für das Kulturhauptstadt-Event zur Verfügung stand, repariert und restauriert werden konnten, gestaltete sich die Wiederherstellung der Oper als einziges Desaster. Statt der angekündigten Opernaufführungen, mit denen Istanbul seinen europäischen Charakter unterstreichen wollte, gab es lediglich Streitereien vor Gericht, um Baugenehmigungen, Geld und Kompetenzen. Bis heute dämmert das Opernhaus am zentralen Taksim Platz ungenutzt vor sich hin. Trotzdem zog Sekib Avdagic, Chef der Agentur für die Vermarktung der Kulturhauptstadt 2010, am Ende eine positive Bilanz. Denn die Besuchszahlen der Stadt erreichten in diesem Jahr einen neuen Rekord. Avdagic ist außerdem davon überzeugt, dass das Kulturhauptstadt-Jahr Istanbul als Tourismusziel auch für die Zukunft unterstützt hat ? und das war schließlich das wichtigste Ziel überhaupt.

description.hltext_display: DJ UK Summary: London Stocks Seen Slightly Lower, Data Eyed
description.content:
LONDON (Dow Jones)--Pathfinder Minerals PLC (PFP.LN), an investment company in mining exploration and development, said Wednesday it is in advanced negotiations with a third party to acquire that company's issued share capital in a deal that would constitute a reverse takeover. MAIN FACTS: -However, a reverse takeover hasn't been completed within the prescribed timeframe and therefore trading in the Company's shares will be temporarily suspended with effect from Wednesday. -In the event the Company doesn't complete an acquisition constituting a reverse takeover by June 23, 2011, the Company's shares will be cancelled from trading on AIM.
-Company expects to make a further announcement shortly. -Shares suspended at 6.88 pence valuing the company at GBP3.41 million. -By Ian Walker, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9296; ian.walker@dowjones.com (END) Dow Jones Newswires December 22, 2010 02:38 ET (07:38 GMT)Copyright (c) 2010 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

description.hltext_display: La vanità e il duello. L?amore a filo d?acqua
description.content: Alessio Nannini ANIMALI. Due recenti ricerche hanno evidenziato come i meccanismi di seduzione e di coppia degli animali siano simili a quelli dell’uomo. Ma anche le reazioni a duelli simulati in laboratorio. La femmina si innervosisce se il partner soccombe. Uno studio pubblicato su Behavioral Ecology and Sociobiology ha evidenziato come anche nel regno animale ci sia l’abitudine (molto umana) di farsi la tinta. di Terra

description.hltext_display: Barbara Ann Lynch, 73
description.content:
WATERTOWN -- Funeral services were held Tuesday afternoon, Dec. 21 at Hunter Funeral Home for Ms. Lynch, 73, formerly of Watertown.
A homemaker and a member of Round Lick Baptist Church, she died Saturday, Dec. 18, 2010 at Pine Ridge Care Center in Elizabethon.
Services were conducted by Brother Steve Mayle. Interment was at the Cunningham Cemetery.
Survivors include: children Deborah (Johnny) Shepard of Elizabethton and Ronald (Emily) Blanks of Carthage; brothers Billy (Judy) Lynch of Pleasantview and Joe (Gail) Lynch of Watertown; grandchildren Amy (Jonathan) Huckaba of Elizabethton, Amanda (Todd) Bruce of Greer, S.C. and Tyler (Tanisha Sampson) Blanks of Carthage; great-grandchildren Madison and Megan Greer; as well as several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her parents Dallas P. and Clara Mai Tramel Lynch; infant son Donald Blanks; and the father of her children Bobby Blanks.
Pallbearers: Johnny Shepard, Jonathan Huckaba, Tyler Blanks, Barry Bolton, Steve Cox, Burgess Grooms and Kirk Black.
Watertown's Hunter Funeral Home in charge of arrangements.

description.hltext_display: Valentina e le altre in cerca di giustizia
description.content: Laura Guadagnin* (Terra Nordest) RACCONTO. Un viaggio nella Repubblica Moldova. Storie di donne in attesa di risposte per le violenze subite. Il viaggio in Moldova è seguito alla “parentela” formatasi con un gruppo ormai ampio di moldave, tra cui Vera Cozzaga, presidente dell’associazione Dacia di Mestre che abita anche la nostra sede del Centro Studi Donne per la Pace, sede comunale gestita da Waves (Women arts venice) e da “La 7 Stanza” (centro di poesia) a S.Elena, ex convento dei Servi di Maria, dove ha luogo l’installazione permanente di una “Casamare”, stanza sacra delle case dell’est, luogo di comune incontro e scambio umano con una cultura a rischio di spari di Terra

description.hltext_display: 07:26 Kakuta wants regular football
description.content:
Chelsea forward Gael Kakuta set his sights on earning a regular place in Carlo Ancelotti's first team after committing his future to the club by signing a new four-and-a-half year deal on Tuesday.
Reports had suggested the French youngster could be set to leave Stamford Bridge at the end of the season after talks that opened in September failed to come to an agreement over a contract extension.
"Since I signed for Chelsea when I was 16 all I was thinking about was to get to the first team," said Kakuta, who has made nine appearances for the club this season.
"Now I have been playing a few times with the first team and I have signed for four-and-a-half more years, I have to make a way for myself into the starting 11 and make my dream come true.
"The manager said to me it is the right time to play and I think for me it is as well. It's my job to do my best and try to play more often and show the coach that I am good enough to play in the team."
Blues boss Carlo Ancelotti has put faith in Kakuta, Dutch youngster Jeffrey Bruma and English prospect Josh McEachran, rather than dip into the transfer market this season.
The Italian also hopes to add 15-year-old Feyenoord defender Nathan Ake in January.
The Londoners are understood to have come to an agreement with the Dutch club over the transfer of the youngster, who is expected to sign a professional contract at Stamford Bridge when he turns 16 in February - a deal which will see Feyenoord receive compensation set by a tribunal.
The move for Ake has caused controversy in Holland, where Feyenoord sporting director Leo Beenhakker, without naming Chelsea specifically, expressed his dismay at how he thinks Premier League clubs are taking youngsters from their clubs before their 16th birthday.
"It's driving me crazy that hot prospects are walking away from us like this," Beenhakker told Dutch newspaper Algemeen Dagblad. "The Premier League clubs spoil the market with their behaviour. Other clubs in Europe aren't doing this kind of things, but the English sides just don't care."

description.hltext_display: YVMC board names 2 new members
description.content:
Blog about this Blog about this page on your steamboatpilot.com blog.
Steamboat Springs — The Yampa Valley Medical Center Board of Trustees has named two new members.
Rich Lowe is past president and chief executive officer of XPEDX, a division of International Paper Co. He spent his career in various divisions of International Paper.
Lowe graduated from the University of Utah with a degree in political science and completed the executive program at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University in 2000.
In Steamboat Springs, he also serves as a SCORE business counselor. He has been vice chairman of the Steamboat Springs Economic Development Council and is president of the Yampa Valley Housing Authority Board of Directors and secretary of Old Town Hot Springs Board of Directors.
Gary Hay held numerous leadership roles with Cessna Aircraft Company in a 36-year career, including marketing and sales, customer service, strategic planning and corporate communications. After retiring as chairman and chief executive officer of Cessna, Hay formed GWH Enterprises, LLC, a management-consultant company.
He earned a degree in business administration from Wichita State University and served in the U.S. Marine Corps Reserve. He holds a commercial pilot certificate.
Hay has held board directorships with Wesley Medical Center, United Way and other organizations in Wichita, Kan., including the county economic development council.
Lowe and Hay are residents of Steamboat Springs.
The 13-member YVMC board volunteers to serve as the governing body of the nonprofit hospital for purposes of compliance licensing, regulatory and accreditation requirements. More information is available at www.yvmc.org/board.

description.hltext_display: Equality Illinois seeks public policy director after Garcia fired
description.author: Dahleen Glanton
description.content:
The CEO of Equality Illinois, the state's largest advocacy group for lesbians and gays, acknowledged this week that the recent departure of outspoken co-founder Rick Garcia has shaken Chicago's gay community, but he said the agency will push forward next year with an aggressive strategy.
Garcia, 53, the group's longtime public policy director whose hard-hitting political style has at times conflicted with the agency's leaders, was fired last week after two decades with the group. His departure came less than three weeks after a major victory in which the Illinois Legislature passed a bill allowing civil unions for same-sex couples.
CEO Bernard Cherkasov said Equality Illinois will begin a search process after the holidays to beef up the policy team. Meanwhile, he said, much of the advocacy work will be carried out by a lobbyist who is on retainer and members of the board of directors.
"Some in the community may look at this and not understand the reason … but as they learn more about our priorities for the coming months and years, they will find for themselves a home within Equality Illinois," Cherkasov said.
Cherkasov declined to discuss the reasons for Garcia's dismissal, but Garcia said it was a result of conflicting styles.
"The style I have has been hard and rough like Chicago politics. You tell the truth, fight hard and keep your eyes on the prize," Garcia said. "(Cherkasov) comes out of the idea that we should be well-mannered, nice and corporate. That doesn't work in Chicago."
Garcia said he will continue his civil rights work.
"I'm not going anywhere," he said. "I'm an activist committed to working for the lesbian and gay community in Illinois, and I will continue to use my contacts to move that agenda forward with or without Equality Illinois."

description.hltext_display: White Plains makes own claim birthplace of Frosty
description.author: Swapna
description.content:
|NORTH CASTLE ? It all started with Armonk claiming to be the birthplace of Frosty the Snowman. Turns out, the songwriters may also have been in a White Plains, Mount Vernon or even Keyser, W. Va., state of mind when they wrote the catchy holiday tune.
On Dec. 11, the Town of North Castle threw a parade to welcome Frosty back to his "hometown."
The town decided to co-opt Frosty ? 60 years after the song was written ? based on the fact that Steve Nelson, who wrote the song with Walter "Jack" Rollins, had been an Armonk resident from 1953 until his death in 1981.RelatedAlthough the song makes no geographic references other than to a town square, residents believe that Nelson's frequent visits to the hamlet before building his house at 10 Bayberry Road ? and oral history ? are proof enough.But Betsy Spencer, 71, a lifelong resident of White Plains and an old neighbor of the Nelson family's, begs to differ.
Spencer told The Journal News last week that Nelson wrote the song while the family was living at 16 Dusenbury Place in White Plains.
"I was about 10 years old, and I remember Mrs. Nelson singing the song to all the neighborhood kids in her back yard," Spencer said. "She told us that the song was going to be the new Christmas hit. So you could say that White Plains is the birthplace of Frosty the Snowman."
But what about Jack Rollins?
Rollins, a Keyser, W.Va, native ? where he is also buried ? was a longtime resident of Mount Vernon. He is known to have lived there from 1930 to at least 1950.
A March 1950 article in The Reporter Dispatch, a predecessor of The Journal News, describes the partnership on the duo's then newly released Easter hit, "Here Comes Peter Cottontail."
"Mr. Nelson said he complained one morning to Mr. Rollins that he was tired ? that he had not been able to get his boy to go to sleep and had been telling him Peter Cottontail stories," the article says. "Mr. Rollins thought 'Peter' would make a good story and dashed off the lyrics in about six minutes. Mr. Nelson put them to music."(2 of 2)The article goes on to say that Peter Cottontail was scheduled to reach the "Hit Parade" the night before Easter and that Walt Disney was planning a movie on the character. Through what can be described as a cosmic coincidence, Rollins and Nelson have both independently captured the public's interest, some 60 years after their biggest hit was written.
If Nelson vaulted into North Castle's collective consciousness in December, the West Virginia Music Hall of Fame announced recently that Rollins would be inducted Oct. 15 into its 2011 Hall of Fame.
Both musicians were primarily known as composers of country, children's and holiday songs.Related"The reason we founded the West Virginia Music Hall of Fame in 2005 was to showcase the great talents of people who have a strong connection to the state," said Jeff Shirley, curator of the hall foundation. "The children in New York and California probably don't need more people they can look up to, but here, we can certainly use them. And 'Frosty the Snowman' is just a wonderful song to be associated with."
North Castle Councilwoman Rebecca Kittredge, who earlier told The Journal News that back in 1950s, Armonk was such a quaint little village that "you could picture the snowman running down Main Street," said she was willing to share the fame.
"As far as I am concerned , it's the holiday season," Kittredge said. "And if White Plains wants to share Frosty with North Cas

event_or_fact.property: Nelson wrote the song while the family was living at 16 Dusenbury Place in White Plains."

description.hltext_display: Kaviar aus Südfrankreich
description.content:
An Festtagen haben die Fischeier Hochkonjunktur ? echter Rogen vom Stör kommt längst nicht mehr nur aus Russland / Gourmets sollten ein paar Regeln beachten. ARCACHON (dpa). Im Kaspischen Meer sind sie wegen Raubfischerei fast ausgestorben, deshalb werden Störe aus Sibirien überall in Europa gezüchtet ? zum Beispiel an der französischen Atlantikküste. Das Geschäft mit der Delikatesse Kaviar lockt.
Störe haben keine Schuppen, keine Gräten, keine Zähne und seit 250 Millionen Jahren ein unverändert stromlinienförmiges Aussehen. "Sie haben ein phlegmatisches Naturell, fressen Algen und schmecken als Süßwasserfische ziemlich fade", sagt Heather Ducretot von der Störzuchtfarm Le Moulin de la Cassadotte, nicht weit von Arcachon an der französischen Atlantikküste. Ein langweiliger Fisch also? Ja, wenn da nicht der Kaviar wäre, das "schwarze Gold der Zaren", das einst die wilden Störe aus dem Kaspischen Meer oder den sibirischen Flüssen lieferten. Heute ist Wildkaviar eine Rarität, Zuchtkaviar die Regel. "Die Herkunft ist eigentlich sekundär. Viel wichtiger sind die Auswahl, die Art der Zucht und die Reifung der Stör-Eier", sagt Armen Petrossian, Chef des gleichnamigen Kaviar-Handelshauses in Paris. "Bei richtig gutem Kaviar aus der Zucht sind die Unterschiede zu Wildkaviar so gering, dass sie nur Kenner entdecken." Petrossian muss es wissen. Der Kaviarhandel wird in seiner Familie seit Generationen betrieben. Werbung Le Moulin de la Cassadotte liegt in einem Waldgebiet nicht weit vom Meer. In der zwölf Hektar großen Anlage tummeln sich 70 000 Störe der Art Ascipenser Baeri, die in der 70er Jahren aus Sibirien importiert wurde. 1985 begann man mit der Zucht der Störe und 1993 mit der Kaviarproduktion. Die Betreiber achten auf eine möglichst naturbelassene und schonende Produktion ? das heißt, die Fische haben in den Becken genug Platz, das Wasser stammt aus reinen Quellen und die Kaviarproduktion wird nicht maximiert. Gespeist werden die Becken durch einen Fluss aus dem "Naturpark der Gascogne", dessen Sandboden der beste Wasserfilter ist. Diese Störe bekommen keine Antibiotika. Wenn sie sterben, dann kaum an Infektionen. "Sie werden manchmal von Kormoranen gefangen oder auch Opfer von Wasserratten", sagt Ducretot. Im kommenden Jahr sollen in der "Mühle" zwei Tonnen Kaviar produziert werden, etwa doppelt so viel wie in diesem Jahr. "Man könnte sehr viel mehr produzieren, aber das ginge auf Kosten der Qualität." Bei einem Preis von 2000 bis 2500 Euro pro Kilogramm Kaviar lohnt sich die Mäßigung. Kurz vor der Schlachtung kommen die Störweibchen in ein Sonderbecken mit glasklarem, 17 Grad kaltem Brunnenwasser aus 200 Meter Tiefe, um jede Infektion oder Unreinheit zu verhindern. Diese Art der schonenden Störzucht weiß auch Petrossian zu schätzen. Auch von Moulin de la Cassadotte lässt er sich Spitzenprodukte nach Paris liefern. Es ist kein Zufall, dass die Störzucht ausgerechnet in Südwestfrankreich betrieben wird. Im 19. Jahrhundert schwammen wilde Störe in den französischen Flüssen, so wie übrigens auch in der Elbe in Deutschland. Auch damals wurden die Eier der Störweibchen verwendet: allerdings ganz profan als Köder für Aale, Futter für Enten, Tauben oder Schweine. Es mussten erst die Russen kommen, um in Westeuropa aus dem Viehfutter eine Delikatesse für Gutbetuchte zu machen. Nach der Oktoberrevolution Anfang des 20. Jahrhunderts flohen viele Russen nach Frankreich. Als sie die Störe in den französischen Flüssen entdeckten, brauchten sie nicht lange, um ein Geschäft daraus zu machen. Zu den prominenten Exilanten gehörten die Brüder Melkoum und Mouchegh Petrossian, die in den 20er Jahren in Paris den Kaviarhandel Petrossian gründeten. Heute ist ihr Haus im vornehmen siebten Stadtbezirk einer der besten Kaviarhändler der Welt, wie die Besitzer behaupten. Die schwarzen kleinen Eier, eisgekühlt, werden teelöffelweise goutiert. Ihren Geschmack zu beschreiben, fällt schwer. "Man kann den Geschmack von Kaviar mit nichts vergleichen, es ist ein einzigartiges Produkt", sagt Ducretot. Leicht salzig, aber nicht wie Austern, und schon gar nicht wie ordinäre Fischeier, die in kleinen Glastöpfchen in Supermarktregalen angeboten werden. Kaviar drückt man mit der Zunge gegen den Gaumen, und richtig gut sind die Kügelchen nur, wenn sie ziemlich fest sind, also "al dente", und im Mund förmlich explodieren. Als Getränk passen eiskalter Wodka, Champagner oder ein leichter Weißwein. Ein Tabu: Wer Kaviar mit Zitrone oder Zwiebeln versetzt, weiß nicht, was gut ist. Beluga-Kaviar ist der feinste und teuerste. Ossietra-Fischeier schmecken etwas nussartig und Sevruga-Kaviar hat ein kräftiges und würziges Aroma. Niemals auf Metall! Zur sachkundigen Kostprobe gehört der Grundsatz, Kaviar niemals auf einem Metall- oder Inox-Löffel in den Mund zu schieben. Nur auf Porzellan, Knochen oder Plastik, denn Metall oxidiert und schadet dem Geschmack. Gourmets servieren ihn auf Eis, mit Toast und leichter Butter, vielleicht mit einem Hauch frischer Sahne. Beim französischen Sternekoch Alain Dutournier in Paris bekommt man als Beilage nichts weiter als eine sorgfältig ausgewählte kleine Kartoffel, aufgeschnitten und lauwarm. Seit 1998 wird der Export von wildem Kaviar durch das Washingtoner Artenschutzübereinkommen CITES streng reglementiert. Seit 1999 muss jede Dose über 250 Gramm aus Russland und dem Iran mit Papieren versehen werden, um den illegalen Handel zu erschweren.

description.hltext_display: Frattini contro la Ue: "Blocchi subito la distribuzione dei diari senza festa di Natale"
description.author: online@quotidiano.net (Redazione
description.content:
Per il ministro degli Esteri non basta l’ammissione dell’errore da parte della Commissione Europea: "Chiederemo formalmente all’UE di sapere chi ne è responsabile"
Roma, 21 dicembre 2010 - Franco Frattini ha ribadito la richiesta che l’Ue blocchi la distribuzione in tutte le scuole secondarie d’Europa di oltre tre milioni di copie di un diario-agenda in cui sono indicate tutte le feste religiose dell’anno ad eccezione della festività cristiana del Natale.
Intervistato da Mattino 5, il ministro degli Esteri ha aggiunto che non basta l’ammissione dell’errore da parte della Commissione Europea: "È troppo comodo - ha detto - chiederemo formalmente all’UE di sapere chi ne è responsabile". Il capo della Farnesina ha attaccato l’Europa accusandola di scarsa attenzione sul tema delle persecuzioni dei cristiani nel mondo: "Ieri ne ho parlato con Hillary Clinton al telefono, anche lei preoccupata, ed è, francamente, triste che l’Europa non si muova".

1.2 million Iraqi families enjoy social welfare salaries
description.content:
BAGHDAD: About 1.2 million Iraqi families have been covered by the social welfare salaries in different parts of the country, according to a statement by the Ministry of Labor & Social Affairs on Tuesday.
"The number of families covered by the social welfare salaries in different parts of Iraq has reached about 1.2 millions," a Ministry's media source told Aswat al-Iraq news agency, adding that their salaries will be distributed at the end of the current month, according to the mechanism laid by the Ministry for the elderly, disabled and unemployed people.
He said that the salaries range from 50,000 Iraqi dinars for each person, 70,000 dinars for two, 90,000 for three, 100,000 for four, 110,000 for five, 120,000 for 6 and above.
A U.S. dollars equals about 1,118 Iraq dinars approx.
"The Ministry has laid a new mechanism for persons, covered with social welfare, comprising a committee of social researchers, a municipality member in earch area, along with a social welfare employee, and the committee would carry out visits on random basis to different areas of Iraq," the source concluded.
© Aswat Aliraq 2010

description.hltext_display: Kuba und wie es die Welt sieht
description.content:
Wenn Kommunisten das Wikipedia-Prinzip ad absurdum führen, löst das schnell einen Besserwisser-Reflex aus. Doch auch beim musterdemokratischen großen Nachbarn gibt es fragwürdige Online-Enzyklopädien.
Homepage von EcuRed.cu, der kubanischen Variante der Wikipedia. Foto: AFP
Es ist normal, dass erfolgreiche Ideen im Internet kopiert werden. Suchmaschinen zum Beispiel, soziale Netzwerke, Videoplattformen – und Wikis. Vor einigen Tagen hat Kuba eine eigene Wikipedia bekommen. Die ersten Reaktionen von Journalisten kamen schnell: EcuRed.cu sehe dem Vorbild äußerlich ähnlich - führe das Wikipedia-Prinzip aber ad absurdum und biete dadurch einen gewissen Unterhaltungswert. Wenn man nicht zufällig in Kuba lebt.

description.hltext_display: CountWise and Q-Matic Partner for Global Distribution of Advanced Queue Management Solution
description.author: CountWise
description.content: --(PR.com)-- CountWise, a world leader in people counting and queue management technologies and systems, and Q-Matic, a leading global vendor of queue management systems, today announced the formation of a partnership to deliver to the retail, banking, public transportation and other key markets a technologically advanced and highly accurate queue management solution.The companies plan to integrate CountWises innovative technology into the world leading Q-Matic system to provide customer with additional critical information. The synergies between the two solutions will deliver a compelling solution to queue management challenges, empowering retailers and other establishments with the tools to meet their Key Performance Indicators and offer their targeted customer experience.We view our partnership with Q-Matic as a milestone event in the advancement of queue management as a critical tool for retailers, banks and other businesses wishing to deliver a consistently high level of service, said Ilan Levran, CountWise CEO. As CountWise has grown into a world leader in people counting solutions we have sought to expand the use of our innovative technologies to incorporate a sophisticated queue management solution. We believe our integration alongside Q-Matic has resulted in the creation of the best such product available.Combining Two Leading Systems into One Complete Queue Management SolutionThe solution delivered by the integration of CountWise and Q-Matic technologies provides for a video based multi-zone queue management product that utilizes military grade shape recognition technology and customer behavior to deliver superior results. The partnership between CountWise and Q-Matic has already deployed its joint solution to a number of leading clients in varying markets, resulting in validation of the product and confirmation of its advanced capabilities.About CountWiseCountWise is a global technology company providing people-traffic monitoring and queue management solutions to private and public entities. Its suite of innovative products and services helps businesses optimize people counting, customer behavior, and queue management for improved efficiency and profitability. Whether capturing traffic flows, preventing queue bottlenecks, monitoring zone activity, or managing data applications, CountWise products address the full range of traffic-monitoring challenges with unparalleled accuracy and reliability. As a result, businesses are able to improve their operations by increasing conversion ratios, optimizing staffing, improving customer service and experience, and objectively measuring marketing strategy effectiveness.###CountWise, a world leader in people counting and queue management technologies and systems, and Q-Matic, a leading global vendor of queue management systems, today announced the formation of a partnership to deliver to the retail, banking, public transportation and other key markets a technologically advanced and highly accurate queue management solution.
